text: Jimmie Durham (July 10, 1940 â€“ November 17, 2021) was an American-Swiss sculptor, essayist and poet. He was active during the civil rights movements of African Americans and Native Americans in the 1960s and 1970s. He spent most of his career in Switzerland. He said that he was a Cherokee but that claim has been denied by tribal representatives. Durham died on November 17, 2021 in Berlin, Germany at the age of 81. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2021 deaths Category:American sculptors Category:American essayists Category:American poets Category:American civil rights activists Category:Swiss sculptors Category:Swiss poets Category:Swiss activists Category:Writers from Houston Category:Writers from Arkansas Category:20th-century artists Category:21st- century artists
title: Jimmie Durham
